page.title: 04STURSTON
page.content: {Sturston Mill}was knocked down in 1982 by a company called Nestles at a cost of 5000 pounds.All that is left of the mill is a wooden post.The mill was driven by water to grind the wheat into flour and it was made of wood and corrugated iron. The bridge which goes over the river is made of stone and was built in 1855 .The river used to have fish in it but {Severn Trent Water Authority}poisoned them off. The farm is being rebuilt and is used for beef farming.They have a new barn which has hay in it.Hens,chickens and geese wander around the farm.There is grass in the fields and hedges surrounding them. The date of the farm is not known as the deeds have been burnt.Some of the windows on the farm are blocked up and stables there are used for storage.
